channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Remnants of a car fire and possible melted tarmac, 10th November
item.description:
Remnants of a car fire and possible melted tarmac, Very uneven with debris.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62,64,66, Windermere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement totally inaccessible for wheelchair, 10th November
item.description:
This pavement is atrocious along the A435 in Colesbourne from the thatched cottage on A435 going south to the bus stop in Colesbourne village the pavement is mostly impassable on foot let alone in a wheelchair. We cannot take my grandfather out in his wheelchair because the pavement has been so badly neglected that in places it’s non existent. Moss, stones and vegetation have all taken over. My Mum (81) won’t now walk to the bus stop due to the bad state of the pavement that she had to walk on the road in places but with cars travelling too fast along this road she’s now not able to use the footpath at all so totally closing off this lifeline to the outside World for her and many in this village. This should be an easy fix and would make a huge difference to the elderly that live in the village to provide them with a safe pavement on which to walk to access the bus stop, local shop and others in the village. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Colesbourne, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Continued Filthy Flooding, 10th November
item.description:
Water draining down in a constant stream visibly emanating from Pardon Hill Farm forms a large and extremely dirty standing pond of water on the carriageway just prior to a crest making it doubly dangerous to manoeuvre around coupled with making all cars in the vicinity continuously filthy .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.description:

item.title: Very dangerous twin roundabouts., 9th November
item.description:
Temporary new roundabout junction of Leckhampton Hill and A436 as part of A417 Missing Link works. I have been almost hit twice leaving Leckhampton Hill by person's not realising the painted roundabout exists, and they drive at speed heading toward seven springs. Drivers leave the old air balloon roundabout, and in the close confines of the bollards area, they accelerate directly across the painted roundabout. This means they do not look left for traffic entering the roundabout, they approach at speed, and drive in a straight line as though no roundabout is there. This is causing several near misses every morning in busy traffic. Someone will be hurt soon, if not so already. The roundabout should be coned centrally to force drivers to slow, proceed in a correct manner, and check traffic indication from their right, and entries from Leckhampton Hill, prior to arrival at the roundabout. Please call the a417 missing link group to monitor and change the layout and markings. And cones immediately. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ullenwood Junction, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface erosion, 9th November
item.description:
The road outside Bishops Cottage, Blacksmith`s Lane, The Leigh is eroded. As well as several large, deep potholes, there are shallow potholes, surface deterioration, edge failure, cracking and rutting. It is becoming very difficult to drive on, and an increasing risk to vehicles being damaged. The road in this section requires resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
